In Julia, Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

Here is how you can implement the solution in Julia:

```julia
using Dates

function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime; bump::Int=3)
    if typeof(dt) != DateTime
        throw(ArgumentError("Provided argument must be of DateTime type"))
    end

    return dt + Hour(bump)
end
```
This function takes a `DateTime` object as an input and increases it by the number of hours specified in the `bump` parameter. By default, if no value is provided for `bump`, it will increase the time by 3 hours. If the input isn't a DateTime type, it throws an error.
